results.title: I'm feeling happy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Children sing about and experience a number of things that bring happiness: The pleasures of smelling and eating good things, a bubbly bath, waking up on a sunny morning; the accomplishment of learning to drive, the inner satisfaction of being helpful without thought of reward and the warmth of sharing a friendship.

results.title: I'm a mammal and so are you
results.creator_credit: International Cinemedia Centre and ONF | NFB

results.title: I'm a little teapot
results.brief_description: 35 delightful and well known activity songs and rhymes presented by Elizabeth Watts which will entertain and delight young children. Apart from the title song, “I’m a little teapot”, classic songs such as “Humpty Dumpty”, “Baa baa black sheep” and “The Hokey cokey” are featured.

results.title: I'm a fool
results.creator_credit: Perspective Films, Dan McCann and Noel Black
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This adaptation of Sherwood Anderson’s short story tells of a few milestones in the life of an adolescent boy who, at the turn of the century, left home and attempted to make a life of his own. Stars Ron Howard.

results.title: I'll tell you where to put your airport

results.title: I'll play my guitar softly
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Kindergarten children are observed here responding to the rhythm of music. The teacher, while playing a guitar, encourages different responses at different times, sometimes the rhythmic cadence of sticks and sometimes a vocal response. At the conclusion the children disperse in an orderly way for refreshment and “quiet time”.

results.title: I'll go again
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Michael McKennirey and Paul Cowan
results.brief_description: I’ll Go Again is a film about four athletes and a team that competed in the 1976 Montreal Olympics. They had trained courageously to be among those who would mount the podium to receive a medal. None did. Was it worth it? The film answers the question. (Awards: Budapest; Yorkton)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Michael McKennirey and Paul Cowan

results.title: I'll get you for this = Lucky Nick Cain
results.creator_credit: Kaydor Productions, Romulus Films, Joseph Kaufman and Joseph M. Newman
results.brief_description: Based on James Hadley Chase’s novel of the same name, this crime thriller tells the story of Nick Cain (George Raft), American gambler visiting the Mediterranean town of San Paola where he befriends a young orphan shoe-shine boy named Toni (Enzo Staiola). Nick soon finds his way to the casino where all is not quite as it appears and trouble it seems has a way of finding him. Enter the lovely Kay Wonderly (Coleen Gray) a tourist who becomes a victim to the Casino, losing all her money and at the mercy of the Casino managers. Fate takes a hand and before long Nick and Kay find themselves not only sharing a mutual attraction but also of having been framed for murdering a US Treasury Agent. Hiding Kay away in a small village, Nick sets about doing a bit of his own detective work to find out just who the real murderers are. A film classic of drama and intrigue. Cast also includes Charles Goldner, Walter Rilia, Greta Grynt. Features an introduction and conclusion summary by Bill Collins.

results.title: I'll find a way
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Yuki Yoshida, Kathleen Shannon and Beverly Shaffer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children of Canada”.
When nine-year-old Nadia is allowed to attend a regular school, she knows the kids will tease her but she’ll “find a way to deal with it.” Nadia has spina bifida, a congenital condition that has caused a lack of sensation from the knees down. She uses crutches in order to walk. Nadia, in her own candid way, makes it clear that she is not looking for sympathy. She can do many things that children do, only she has a different way of doing them. (Ten Awards including Oscar, Hollywood; Salerno; Dubuque)
